abstract: Maryland authorities investigating carbon-monoxide death of eight people in Princess Anne say utility Delmarva Power disconnected electrical power at rental home of kitchen worker Rodney Todd and his seven children not because they were behind on their bills, but because stolen meter was unsafe; family died when portable generator bought to heat home ran out of gas, pumping toxic fumes.
lead_paragraph: Carbon monoxide killed the children and the father, who bought a generator for warmth, relatives said, after Delmarva Power disconnected a stolen meter for what it called safety reasons.

headline.main: Utility Cut Off Stolen Meter Before Family of 8 Died in Maryland
headline.print_headline: Utility Cut Off Stolen Meter Before Death of Family of 8

snippet: Carbon monoxide killed the children and the father, who bought a generator for warmth, relatives said, after Delmarva Power disconnected a stolen meter for what it called safety reasons.
